    • Method Detail

      • rungeKutta4

        public static OdeSolver.Variables[] rungeKutta4(int n,
                                                double h,
                                                OdeSolver.Variables xy0,
                                                OdeSolver.Rhs rhs)
        Performs Runge-Kutta integration for fixed number of constant-sized steps.
        Parameters:
        n - number of integration steps
        h - integration step size (constant)
        xy0 - integration starting point, initial x and y values
        rhs - right-hand side of the differential equation being integrated

      • rungeKuttaAdaptive

        public static OdeSolver.Variables[] rungeKuttaAdaptive(OdeSolver.Variables xy0,
                                                       double xf,
                                                       double eps,
                                                       OdeSolver.Rhs rhs)
        Runge-Kutta integration using an adaptive step-size.
        Parameters:
        xy0 - integration starting point, initial x and y values
        xf - integration end point, final x value
        eps - desired absolute accuracy in dependent variables
        rhs - right-hand side of the differential equation being integrated

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Test of integration algorithm. Sample system is y1' = -y2; y2' = +y1; for which the solution is y1 = cos(x), y2 = sin(x). Initial value is x = 0, and integrates to x = 2Pi.
